abstract: Indonesian Pres Joko Widodo instructs government officials to investigate anti-Communist purges of mid-1960s, signaling possible end to decades of official reluctance to confront bloody chapter of country's history
lead_paragraph: It was a sign that the government might end its official reluctance to confront the 1965-66 purges, in which hundreds of thousands may have been killed.

headline.main: Indonesia Moves to Investigate Anti-Communist Atrocities
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Moves to Investigate Anti-Communist Purges of 1960s

snippet: It was a sign that the government might end its official reluctance to confront the 1965-66 purges, in which hundreds of thousands may have been killed.
